alert.note: Alert for Creek; McIntosh; Okfuskee; Okmulgee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 10 at 5:23AM CDT until June 10 at 6:15AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Creek County in northeastern Oklahoma... Central McIntosh County in southeastern Oklahoma... Okmulgee County in northeastern Oklahoma... Okfuskee County in east central Oklahoma... * Until 615 AM CDT. * At 523 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 2 miles southwest of Mounds to 6 miles southwest of Slick to 7 miles southeast of Davenport, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations in or near the path include... Okmulgee... Okemah... Okfuskee... Henryetta... Checotah... Morris... Beggs... Boley... Mounds... Weleetka... Dewar... Schulter... Paden... Grayson... Bearden... Slick... Hoffman... Castle... Clearview... Stidham... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 212 and 264. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
